intro: Rotala saxatilis, commonly known as the rock peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Rotala saxatilis is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
